name: Jalapeno Green Onion Ale Corn Bread
author: Karen Moorse
summary: This sweet and spicy corn bread is perfect for a Mexican meal or grilled food.
ingredients: ½ cup beer (brown ale- or pilsner-style)
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Whisk cornmeal, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl
Mix buttermilk, beer, and melted butter in a separate bowl; gradually stir into the cornmeal mixture to incorporate into a batter
Add eggs and sugar to the batter; stir
Fold green onions and jalapeno pepper through the batter; pour into prepared loaf pan
Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to cool completely on a wire rack
